formal-spec.content: connected(G) ‚áî ‚àÄn‚ÇÅ, n‚ÇÇ ‚àà N: ‚àÉ path from n‚ÇÅ to n‚ÇÇ

formal-definition.content: $traverse(n: N, depth: ‚Ñï) ‚Üí Set‚ü®N‚ü© = {n' ‚àà N : distance(n, n') ‚â§ depth}$
$neighbors(n: N) ‚Üí Set‚ü®N‚ü© = {n' ‚àà N : (n, n') ‚àà E ‚à® (n', n) ‚àà E}$

operation.name: Path
operation.signature: path(n‚ÇÅ: N, n‚ÇÇ: N) ‚Üí Sequence‚ü®N‚ü© | null

formal-definition.content:
$path(n‚ÇÅ: N, n‚ÇÇ: N) ‚Üí Sequence‚ü®N‚ü© | null = shortest path from n‚ÇÅ to n‚ÇÇ, or null
    if none exists$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÉtransform: simplify(T) = T' where semantics(T) = semantics(T') ‚àß complexity(T') ‚â§ complexity(T)

formal-definition.content: $parse(s: String) ‚Üí Tree | ParseError = construct AST from string representation$

$eval(T: Tree,
        context: Map‚ü®String,Value‚ü©) ‚Üí Value = case T.root of Literal(v) ‚Üí v Variable(x) ‚Üí context[x] Operator(op) ‚Üí op(map(eval,
        T.children))$
$simplify(T: Tree) ‚Üí Tree = apply rewrite rules until fixpoint$

formal-spec.content: extend(M, k, v) ‚Üí M' where keys(M'.data) = keys(M.data) ‚à™ {k}

operation.name: Add Field
operation.signature: add(M: Metadata, k: String, v: Value) ‚Üí Metadata

formal-definition.content:
$add(M: Metadata, k: String, v: Value) ‚Üí Metadata = M'
    where M'.data[k] = v
    ‚àß validate(M'.schema[k], v)$

operation.name: Index
operation.signature: index(docs: Set‚ü®Document‚ü©, field: String) ‚Üí Map‚ü®Value, Set‚ü®Document‚ü©‚ü©

formal-definition.content: $index(docs: Set‚ü®Document‚ü©, field: String) ‚Üí Map‚ü®Value, Set‚ü®Document‚ü©‚ü© = group documents by field value$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄs ‚àà states: s is immutable once committed
branch(s, name) creates new branch from state s

formal-definition.content: $checkout(H: History, t: Time) ‚Üí State = states[max{i : states[i].timestamp ‚â§ t}]$

operation.name: Diff
operation.signature: diff(H: History, t‚ÇÅ: Time, t‚ÇÇ: Time) ‚Üí Delta

formal-definition.content: $diff(H: History, t‚ÇÅ: Time, t‚ÇÇ: Time) ‚Üí Delta = compute difference between states at t‚ÇÅ and t‚ÇÇ$

$revert(H: History, t: Time) ‚Üí History = H'
    where H'.states = H.states + [checkout(H, t)]$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄi ‚àà Input: store(i) ‚áí validator(i) = Valid No invalid input reaches storage
‚àÄv ‚àà Valid: normalizer(v) produces consistent Internal format

formal-definition.content:
$capture(input: Input) ‚Üí Effect = case validator(input) of Valid(v) ‚Üí store(normalizer(v)) Invalid(e) ‚Üí log_error(e);
        reject(input)$

$validate(input: Input) ‚Üí Valid | Invalid = check_schema(input)
    ‚àß check_constraints(input)
    ‚àß check_permissions(input)$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄp ‚àà ParsedData: transformer(p) conforms to internal schema
‚àÄd ‚àà InternalData: integrator(d) applies merge strategy consistently

formal-definition.content:
$import(source: ExternalFormat,
        strategy: MergeStrategy) ‚Üí Effect = parsed := parser(source) internal := transformer(parsed) integrator(internal,
        strategy)$

$parse(source: ExternalFormat) ‚Üí ParsedData = case format_of(source) of
        JSON ‚Üí parse_json(source)
        CSV ‚Üí parse_csv(source)
        XML ‚Üí parse_xml(source)
        _ ‚Üí error("Unsupported format")$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄe‚ÇÅ, e‚ÇÇ ‚àà Stream: timestamp(e‚ÇÅ) < timestamp(e‚ÇÇ) ‚áí process_order(e‚ÇÅ) < process_order(e‚ÇÇ)

formal-definition.content:
$stream(source: Source) ‚Üí Effect = for event in source.events(): buffer.enqueue(event)
    if buffer.full(): apply_backpressure() process_next()$
$process(event: Event) ‚Üí ProcessedEvent = validated := validate(event) enriched := enrich(validated) return enriched$
$emit(event: ProcessedEvent) ‚Üí Effect = for subscriber in subscribers: subscriber.callback(event)$
$compose(stages: Sequence‚ü®Stage‚ü©) ‚Üí (Input ‚Üí Output) = Œª input: fold(stages, input, Œª(acc, stage): stage(acc))$

$handle_error(error: Error, stage: Stage) ‚Üí Recovery = case error_type(error) of
        Transient ‚Üí Retry(stage, max_attempts=3)
        Permanent ‚Üí Abort(error)
        Recoverable ‚Üí Fallback(alternative_stage)$

$orchestrate(tasks: Queue‚ü®Task‚ü©) ‚Üí Effect = while ¬¨empty(tasks): task := dequeue_by_priority(tasks) agent := coordinator(task)
    if agent.busy: re_enqueue(task) else: assign(task, agent)$

$assign(task: Task,
        agent: Agent) ‚Üí Effect = agent.busy := true result := agent.execute(task) results[task] := result agent.busy := false notify_completion(task,
        result)$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄn ‚àà graph: recompute(n) ‚áî (invalidated(n) ‚à® ‚àÉd ‚àà dependencies(n): invalidated(d)) Only recompute what changed

formal-definition.content: $update(changed: Set‚ü®Node‚ü©) ‚Üí Effect = affected := transitive_dependencies(changed) invalidate(affected) sorted := topological_sort(affected) for node in sorted: cache[node] := recompute(node)$

$invalidate(nodes: Set‚ü®Node‚ü©) ‚Üí Set‚ü®Node‚ü© = invalidated := nodes for node in nodes: for dependent in dependents(node): invalidated := invalidated ‚à™ invalidate({dependent}) return invalidated$
$recompute(node: Node) ‚Üí Value = inputs := {cache[d] : d ‚àà dependencies(node)} return node.compute(inputs)$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄb ‚àà BaseData: base_fields(combine(b, enrichments)) = b Original data preserved
‚àÄe‚ÇÅ, e‚ÇÇ ‚àà enrichers: e‚ÇÅ and e‚ÇÇ can execute in parallel
failure(enricher_i) ‚áè failure(entire_flow) Flow continues with available enrichments

formal-definition.content:
$enrich(base: BaseData) ‚Üí EnrichedData = enrichments := parallel_map(enrichers,
        Œªe: e.enrich(base)) successful := {e : e ‚àà enrichments
    ‚àß ¬¨is_error(e)} return combine(base, successful)$

operation.name: Fetch Enrichment
operation.signature: fetch(source: Enricher, base: BaseData) ‚Üí Enrichment | Error

formal-definition.content:
$fetch(source: Enricher,
        base: BaseData) ‚Üí Enrichment | Error = try: return source.enrich(base) catch timeout: return partial_enrichment(source,
        base) catch error: return error$

$combine(base: BaseData,
        enrichments: Set‚ü®Enrichment‚ü©) ‚Üí EnrichedData = result := base for enrichment in enrichments: result := merge(result,
        enrichment) return result$

formal-spec.content: lim_{t‚Üí‚àû} improvement(model_t) ‚Üí 0 Eventually reaches optimal or near-optimal

formal-definition.content:
$learn(observations: Observations) ‚Üí Model = features := extract_features(observations) model := train(features,
        current_model) validate(model,
        validation_set) return model$

$apply(policy: Policy,
        env: Environment) ‚Üí Actions = state := env.current_state() action := policy.select_action(state) env.execute(action) return action$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄd ‚àà Data: validate(d) finds all violations according to defined rules

formal-definition.content:
$validate(data: Data) ‚Üí Set‚ü®Violation‚ü© = violations := {} for rule in rules:
    if ¬¨rule.check(data): violations := violations ‚à™ {Violation(rule,
        location(data),
        severity(rule))} return violations$

$correct(violation: Violation) ‚Üí Correction =
    if has_automatic_fix(violation): return Automatic(generate_fix(violation)) else: return Manual(suggest_fix(violation))$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄadjustments: system remains stable after applying adjustments No oscillation or divergence
‚àÄu ‚àà Users: preferences(u) stored with user consent ‚àß anonymizable
‚àÄp ‚àà Preferences: score(p, t) = score(p, 0) ¬∑ decay_function(t) Old preferences have less weight

formal-definition.content:
$personalize(user: UserId) ‚Üí Effect = events := track(user) preferences := infer(events) config := personalize(preferences,
        user.explicit_settings) apply(config,
        user.session)$

$infer(events: Sequence‚ü®Event‚ü©) ‚Üí Preferences = features := extract_features(events) patterns := find_patterns(features) preferences := {} for (feature,
        pattern) in patterns: score := calculate_affinity(pattern) preferences[feature] := score return preferences$

$apply(config: Configuration,
        session: Session) ‚Üí Effect = for (setting,
        value) in config: session.set(setting,
        value) content := filter_by_preferences(available_content,
        config) session.recommendations := rank(content,
        config)$

formal-spec.content: state changes ‚Üí render(state) ‚Üí diff ‚Üí patch ‚Üí updated DOM Automatic propagation
‚àÄs‚ÇÅ, s‚ÇÇ ‚àà State: patch(diff(render(s‚ÇÅ), render(s‚ÇÇ))) applies minimal changes
‚àÄs ‚àà State: visual_output(s) = render(s) What you see reflects state

formal-definition.content:
$update(new_state: State) ‚Üí Effect = old_vdom := render(current_state) new_vdom := render(new_state) patch := diff(old_vdom,
        new_vdom) apply_patch(patch,
        real_dom) current_state := new_state$

$diff(old: VirtualDOM, new: VirtualDOM) ‚Üí Patch =
    if old = new: return []
    if different_type(old, new): return [Replace(old, new)]
    if different_props(old,
        new): ops := [UpdateProps(old,
        new)] else: ops := [] ops := ops + diff_children(old.children,
        new.children) return ops$

$apply_patch(patch: Patch, dom: RealDOM) ‚Üí Effect = for op in patch:
 case op of Insert(node,
        parent,
        index) ‚Üí parent.insert_child(node,
        index) Update(node,
        props) ‚Üí node.update_properties(props) Delete(node) ‚Üí node.remove() Move(node,
        new_parent,
        new_index) ‚Üí move(node,
        new_parent,
        new_index)$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄu ‚àà Users, n ‚àà Notifications: deliver(n, channel) only if user_allows(u, channel, type(n))

formal-definition.content:
$notify(event: Event) ‚Üí Effect = notification := trigger(event)
    if should_suppress(notification): return channels := route(notification) for channel in channels: message := format(notification,
        channel) deliver(message,
        channel) log_delivery(notification,
        channel)$

$format(notification: Notification, channel: Channel) ‚Üí Message = case channel of
        Email ‚Üí format_email(notification.subject, notification.body, notification.action_url)
        Push ‚Üí format_push(notification.title, notification.short_text, notification.icon)
        SMS ‚Üí format_sms(notification.short_text, max_length=160)
        InApp ‚Üí format_in_app(notification.full_content)
        Webhook ‚Üí format_json(notification)$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄd ‚àà Data: publish(d) succeeds completely ‚à® rolls back completely

operation.name: Export
operation.signature: export(data: InternalData, format: FormatType, dest: Destination) ‚Üí PublishResult

formal-definition.content:
$export(data: InternalData,
        format: FormatType,
        dest: Destination) ‚Üí PublishResult = try: external := transform(data,
        format)
    if validate(external) ‚â† Valid: return Failure("Validation failed") result := publish(external,
        dest) return result catch error: return Failure(error)$

$transform(data: InternalData, format: FormatType) ‚Üí ExternalFormat = case format of
        JSON ‚Üí serialize_json(data)
        XML ‚Üí serialize_xml(data, schema)
        CSV ‚Üí flatten_to_csv(data)
        PDF ‚Üí render_pdf(data, template)
        HTML ‚Üí render_html(data, template)$

$publish(data: ExternalFormat,
        dest: Destination) ‚Üí PublishResult = case dest of File(path) ‚Üí write_file(path,
        data) return Success(file_url(path)) URL(endpoint) ‚Üí response := http_post(endpoint,
        data) return Success(response.location) API(service) ‚Üí id := service.create(data) return Success(service.url(id)) Storage(bucket) ‚Üí key := bucket.put(data) return Success(bucket.url(key))$

$refresh(view: MaterializedView) ‚Üí Effect = start_transaction() new_result := compute(view.query,
        current_data) cache[view] := new_result last_refreshed[view] := now() commit_transaction() notify_subscribers(view)$

$incremental_refresh(view: MaterializedView,
        changes: Set‚ü®Change‚ü©) ‚Üí Effect = affected := filter_relevant_changes(changes,
        view.query)
    if empty(affected): return // No update needed
    if can_update_incrementally(view,
        affected): cache[view] := apply_incremental_update(cache[view],
        affected) else: refresh(view) // Full refresh$
$edit(user: User, op: Operation) ‚Üí Effect = D_user := apply(op, D_user) broadcast(op, user)$
$receive(op: Operation, u_remote: User) ‚Üí Effect = op' := transform(op, local_ops) D := apply(op', D)$

T(op‚ÇÅ,
        op‚ÇÇ) = adjust op‚ÇÅ for effects of op‚ÇÇ Concurrent inserts at same position: Use user ID as tiebreaker Delete vs Modify: Delete wins

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄe ‚àà Error: classify(e) determines appropriate recovery strategy Transient ‚Üí Retry Permanent ‚Üí Report Recoverable ‚Üí Fallback | GracefulDegradation
‚àÄe ‚àà Error: recover(e) preserves system invariants No partial state corruption

formal-definition.content:
$retry(operation: Operation,
        max_attempts: ‚Ñï) ‚Üí Result | Error = attempts := 0 while attempts < max_attempts: try: return operation() catch error:
    if transient(error): wait(2^attempts ¬∑ base_delay) attempts := attempts + 1 else: throw error throw MaxAttemptsExceeded$

$circuit_breaker(operation: Operation, threshold: ‚Ñï) ‚Üí Result | Error = state := Closed failures := 0 execute():
 case state of
        Closed ‚Üí try: result := operation() failures := 0 return result catch error: failures := failures + 1
    if failures ‚â• threshold: state := Open schedule_half_open(timeout) throw error
        Open ‚Üí throw CircuitOpenError
        HalfOpen ‚Üí try: result := operation() state := Closed return result catch error: state := Open throw error$

operation.name: Graceful Degradation
operation.signature: degrade(levels: Sequence‚ü®Mode‚ü©, operation: Mode ‚Üí Result) ‚Üí Result

formal-definition.content:
$degrade(levels: Sequence‚ü®Mode‚ü©,
        operation: Mode ‚Üí Result) ‚Üí Result = for mode in levels: try: return operation(mode) catch error: continue throw AllModesFailedError$

formal-spec.content: ‚àÄo ‚àà objects: visual(o) = semantic(o) Changes to visual representation directly modify semantic content.

formal-definition.content:
$interpret(gesture: Gesture) ‚Üí Action = case gesture of Click(p) ‚Üí Select(objectAt(p)) Drag(p‚ÇÅ,
        p‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí Move(selected,
        p‚ÇÇ - p‚ÇÅ) Scroll(Œî) ‚Üí Pan(viewport,
        Œî)
        persist(objects: Set‚ü®Element‚ü©) ‚Üí Effect = save_to_storage(objects);
        notify_observers(objects)$

component.name: Sources
component.description: set of source documents with metadata

component.name: Inline_{refs}
component.description: mapping from content spans to sources

formal-spec.content: $\forall span \in \text{Content} : \exists s \in Sources : Inline_{refs}(span) = s.id$ (every claim cited)
$\forall s \in Sources : s.confidence \in [0,1]$ is visible to user

formal-definition.content: $\text{addCitation}(span, src) = C'_{source}$where$Sources' = Sources \cup \{src\}$$Inline_{refs}' = Inline_{refs} \oplus [span \mapsto src.id]$$Links' = Links \cup \{src.URI\}$
$\text{verifyAll}(C_{source}) = \{(s.id, accessible(s.URI)) \mid s \in Sources\}$where$accessible: URI \to Boolean$checks validity

component.name: Path_{retrieval}
component.description: sequence of nodes and edges traversed in graph

formal-spec.content: $\forall (n_i, e_i) \in Path_{retrieval} : \text{explain}(e_i) \to \text{why } n_{i} \to n_{i+1}$ (each hop justified)
$\forall n_i, n_{i+1} \in Path_{retrieval} : Score_{relevance}(n_{i+1}) \leq Score_{relevance}(n_i)$ (decreasing along path)
$\forall i : \exists e \in \text{Edges} : e.source = n_i \land e.target = n_{i+1}$ (valid graph path)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{traceRetrieval}(q, G) = \text{path}$where$n_0 = \arg\max_{n \in G} \text{sim}(q.embedding,
        n.embedding)$$path = [n_0] \oplus \text{expand}(n_0,
        q,
        k)$(k-hop expansion)

component.name: Colors
component.description: color scale from low to high confidence

formal-spec.content: $\forall span \in Text : \exists c \in [0,1] : Conf_{scores}(span) = c$ (every span has confidence)
$\forall i, j : i < j \implies Thresholds[i] < Thresholds[j]$ (increasing sequence)
$\forall t_i, t_{i+1} \in Thresholds : \Delta E(Colors(t_i), Colors(t_{i+1})) > \tau$ (perceptually distinct)

formal-definition.content: $\text{categorize}(c) = \begin{cases} \text{high} & \text{if } c \geq t_3 \\ \text{medium} & \text{if } t_2 \leq c < t_3 \\ \text{low} & \text{if } t_1 \leq c < t_2 \\ \text{uncertain} & \text{if } c < t_1 \end{cases}$where$t_1, t_2, t_3 \in Thresholds$

component.name: Sources
component.description: multiple sources making potentially conflicting claims

formal-spec.content: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in \text{Claims} : \text{contradicts}(c_1, c_2) \implies (c_1, c_2, t) \in Conflicts$ for some $t$

formal-definition.content:
$\text{detectConflicts}(S) = \{(c_1,
        c_2,
        t) \mid$$(s_1,
        c_1),
        (s_2,
        c_2) \in S \land s_1 \neq s_2 \land$$t = \text{classifyConflict}(c_1,
        c_2)\}$

$\text{resolve}(c_1, c_2, t) = r$where$r.merged\_claim = \text{merge}(c_1,
        c_2,
        t)$$r.consensus\_score = \frac{|\text{supporting}(r)|}{|\text{all\_sources}|}$$r.dissenting = \{s \mid s \text{ contradicts } r\}$

component.name: Concepts
component.description: set of semantic concepts to compare

formal-spec.content: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in Concepts : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) = Sim_{matrix}(c_2, c_1)$ (symmetric)
$\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) > Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_3) \implies$   $\|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_2)\| < \|Layout(c_1) - Layout(c_3)\|$ (spatial proximity reflects similarity)
$\forall c_1, c_2 : Sim_{matrix}(c_1, c_2) < Threshold \implies \neg \text{visible}(\text{edge}(c_1, c_2))$

formal-definition.content:
$\text{computeSimilarity}(C, metric) = M$where$M[i,j] = \text{metric}(c_i.embedding,
        c_j.embedding)$$\text{for cosine: } M[i,j] = \frac{e_i \cdot e_j}{\|e_i\| \|e_j\|}$

tuple-notation.content: $U_{auto} = (Content, Sources, Monitor, Update_{trigger}) : Document \times Time \to Document'$

component.name: Content
component.description: original document content to be improved

component.name: Improvements
component.description: set of AI-suggested edits with rationale

component.name: Confidence
component.description: confidence score for each suggested edit

formal-spec.content: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in Improvements : e_1 \neq e_2 \implies e_1.span \cap e_2.span = \emptyset$ (disjoint)
$\forall e \in Improvements : \exists r \in \text{String} : e.reason = r \land |r| > 0$ (all edits explained)

component.name: Display
component.description: how links are rendered in UI

formal-spec.content: $\forall d_1, d_2 \in Docs : Auto_{link}(d_1, d_2) > \theta \implies \exists l \in Relationships : l.source = d_1 \land l.target = d_2$
$\forall l \in Relationships : l.bidirectional = \text{true} \implies \exists l' : l'.source = l.target \land l'.target = l.source$

formal-definition.content:
$\text{discoverLinks}(D) = \{(d_1,
        d_2,
        t,
        b) \mid$$d_1,
        d_2 \in D \land d_1 \neq d_2 \land$$Auto_{link}(d_1,
        d_2) > \theta \land$$t = \text{classifyRelation}(d_1,
        d_2)\}$
$\text{addLink}(d_1, d_2, t) = l$where$l = (d_1, d_2, t, \text{true})$$Relationships' = Relationships \cup \{l\}$
$\text{getRelated}(d, k) = \text{top-k}(\{d' \mid (d, d', t, b) \in Relationships\}, Auto_{link}(d, \cdot))$

component.name: Content
component.description: document content to be checked for staleness

component.name: Freshness
component.description: freshness score per content segment (higher = fresher)

formal-spec.content: $\forall span : Freshness(span) = e^{-\lambda \cdot \Delta t}$ where $\Delta t = \text{now}() - \text{lastUpdated}(span)$

formal-definition.content: $\text{updateFreshness}(span, src) = f'$where$\Delta t = \text{now}() - src.timestamp$$f' = e^{-\lambda \cdot \Delta t}$(exponential decay)

component.name: Agents
component.description: multiple AI agents collaborating on document

component.name: Document
component.description: shared document state with version control

formal-spec.content: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in Contributions : c_1.edit.span \cap c_2.edit.span \neq \emptyset \implies$   $\exists r \in \text{Resolution} : r(c_1, c_2) = c_{merged}$ (CRDT-like)
$\forall a \in Agents : \exists r \in \text{Role} : a.role = r \land \text{expert}(a, r)$
$\forall span \in Document : \exists c \in Contributions : c.edit.span = span$ (traceable authorship)

component.name: Contributors
component.description: humans and AI agents that modified each version

formal-spec.content: $\forall v_i, v_{i+1} \in Versions : Timestamps(v_i) < Timestamps(v_{i+1})$ (monotonic time)
$\forall v_{i+1} \in Versions : \exists v_i : v_{i+1}.parent = v_i.id$ (except root version)
$\forall v \in Versions : Contributors(v) \neq \emptyset$ (every change has author)
$\forall v_i \in Versions : v_i = \text{apply}(v_0, \bigoplus_{j=1}^{i} Changes(v_{j-1}, v_j))$ (replay history)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{computeDelta}(v_1,
        v_2) = \{e \mid e = \text{diff}(v_1.content,
        v_2.content)\}$using Myers' diff algorithm or similar

formal-spec.content: $\forall e \in Events : \Delta t_{display}(e) = t_{render}(e) - e.timestamp < 100ms$ (low latency)
$\forall w \in \text{Windows} : Aggregation(w) = f(\{e \in Events \mid e.timestamp \in w\})$

formal-definition.content:
$\text{renderStream}(S) = v$where$v.\text{timeline} = \{(e.timestamp,
        e.type) \mid e \in S\}$$v.\text{aggregate} = Aggregation(\text{last\_n}(S,
        n))$

component.name: Selector
component.description: predicate and time range for replay selection

component.name: Playback
component.description: controls for playback speed, pause, step

component.name: State_{restore}
component.description: reconstructs system state from event sequence

formal-spec.content: $\forall e_1, e_2 \in History : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies \text{order}(e_1) < \text{order}(e_2)$ in replay

component.name: Stream
component.description: incoming event stream with variable rate

component.name: Drop_{strategy}
component.description: policy for dropping events when overwhelmed

formal-spec.content: $\forall \Delta t : |\{e \in \text{processed} \mid e.timestamp \in [t, t + \Delta t]\}| \leq Rate_{control} \times \Delta t$
$\forall e_1, e_2 \in Buffer : P(\text{drop}(e_1)) = P(\text{drop}(e_2))$ (uniform probability)

formal-spec.content: Agents execute tasks independently without coordination
‚àÄtask ‚àà tasks: ‚àÉagent, time: agent executes task at time

formal-definition.content:
$dispatch(task: Task) ‚Üí Effect = tasks := enqueue(tasks, task, task.priority)
    if ‚àÉagent: agent.status = Idle: assign(agent, task)$

$assign(agent: Agent,
        task: Task) ‚Üí Effect = agent.status := Busy(task) result := agent.execute(task) results[task] := result agent.status := Idle try_assign_next(agent)$

$aggregate() ‚Üí Result =
    if ‚àÄtask ‚àà tasks: task ‚àà keys(results): coord.aggregate(results)$
Idle agents take tasks from busy agents' queues Good load balancing
Central queue, agents pull tasks when idle Simple, fair
High-priority tasks executed first Supports urgency

formal-spec.content: Only send deltas, not full state

formal-definition.content:
$diff(old: State, new: State) ‚Üí Delta = changes := [] for path in keys(old) ‚à™ keys(new):
    if old[path] ‚â† new[path]: changes := changes ++ [Change(path, old[path], new[path])] return changes$

$merge(state: State, delta: Delta) ‚Üí State = for change in delta:
    if ¬¨conflict(change,
        state): state[change.path] := change.new_value else: conflicts := conflicts ++ [Conflict(change.path,
        state[change.path],
        change.new_value)] return state$

$resolve(conflict: Conflict, strategy: Strategy) ‚Üí Value = case strategy of
        LastWriteWins ‚Üí newer(conflict.local_value, conflict.remote_value)
        ManualResolve ‚Üí prompt_user(conflict)
        MergeValues ‚Üí merge_function(conflict.local_value, conflict.remote_value)$
Every œÑ seconds: fetch remote, diff, merge Simple but wasteful
Persistent connection, push updates Real-time, efficient
Transform operations to account for concurrent edits Complex but powerful

formal-spec.content: Items with equal sort keys maintain their original relative order

formal-definition.content: $sort(data: Sequence‚ü®Item‚ü©, order: Order) ‚Üí Sequence‚ü®Item‚ü© = stable_sort(data, composite_comparator(order))$

$composite_comparator(order: Order) ‚Üí Comparator = Œª(item1,
        item2): for (column,
        direction) in order: val1 := column.extract(item1) val2 := column.extract(item2) cmp := compare(val1,
        val2,
        column.type)
    if cmp ‚â† 0: return cmp ¬∑ (direction = Asc ? 1 : -1) return 0 // All keys equal$

$toggle_sort(column: Column) ‚Üí Effect =
    if order[0].column = column: order[0].direction := flip(order[0].direction) else: order := [(column,
        Asc)] ++ order data := sort(data,
    order)$

Debounced updates: Wait œÑ ms after scroll stops Reduces re-renders during scroll 3. Recycled DOM: Reuse DOM nodes for different items Reduces GC pressure 4.         password: String) ‚Üí Effect: this.find(username_input).type(username) this.find(password_input).type(password) this.find(login_button).click() def get_error() ‚Üí String: return this.find(error_message).text() class DashboardPage: locators = { welcome_message: CSS(".welcome"),
        logout_button: CSS("#logout") } def is_displayed() ‚Üí ùîπ: return this.find(welcome_message).is_visible() def logout() ‚Üí Effect: this.find(logout_button).click() e2e_test_user_login_flow() // Setup = browser := launch_browser(Chrome) test_user := create_test_user("testuser",
        "password123") // Navigate to login page login_page := LoginPage(browser) browser.navigate("https://app.example.com/login") // Execute login login_page.login("testuser",
        "password123") // Verify redirect to dashboard dashboard := DashboardPage(browser) assert(dashboard.is_displayed()) assert(contains(dashboard.welcome_message,
        "Welcome,
        testuser")) // Execute logout dashboard.logout() // Verify redirect to login assert(login_page.is_displayed()) // Cleanup delete_test_user(test_user) browser.quit() Browser actions: - navigate(url) - refresh() - back() - forward() - take_screenshot() - execute_script(js) Element actions: - find(locator) ‚Üí Element - click() - type(text) - clear() - submit() - select(option) - hover() - drag_and_drop(source,
        target) Waits: - wait_for_element(locator,
        timeout) - wait_for_visibility(element,
        timeout) - wait_for_text(element,
        text,
        timeout) - wait_for_url(url,
        timeout) Assertions: - assert_visible(element) - assert_text(element,
        expected) - assert_url(expected) - assert_title(expected) - assert_element_count(locator,
        count) 1. Use Page Objects: Encapsulate page structure Reusable across tests Easier maintenance 2. Explicit Waits: Wait for specific conditions Don't use sleep() Handle async behavior 3. Independent Tests: Each test starts from clean state No dependencies between tests Can run in any order 4. Minimize Test Data: Use minimum data needed Clean up after test Avoid shared test data 5. Stable Locators: Use IDs or data attributes Avoid brittle CSS selectors Don't rely on text content Test Environments:** Headless mode: browser := Chrome(headless=true) Faster,
        no GUI Good for CI/CD Grid/Cloud: Run tests on multiple browsers in parallel Selenium Grid,
        BrowserStack,
        Sauce Labs Docker: Consistent environment Isolated tests Easy CI/CD integration$

component.description: token stream from LLM for progressive generation

formal-spec.content: $\forall t \in stream : \exists \Delta UI : render(t) = \Delta UI$ (incremental rendering per token)
$\forall spec \in \text{ComponentSpec} : spec.template \in T_{lib}$ (only valid templates used)

formal-definition.content: $\text{morph}(ui, spec) = ui'$where$\text{diff} = \text{compute\_diff}(ui, spec)$$ui' = \text{apply}(\text{diff}, ui)$(minimal DOM updates)

component.name: Q_{render}
component.description: render task queue for async updates

component.name: T_{ui}
component.description: set of UI variants for different contexts

component.name: R_{adapt}
component.description: adaptation function mapping context to UI

formal-spec.content: $\forall c_1, c_2 \in \text{Context} : c_1 \neq c_2 \implies R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c_1)) \neq R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c_2))$ (distinct contexts ‚Üí distinct UIs)
$\forall s \in U_{state} : \text{adapt}(c) \implies U_{state}' \supseteq s$ (state persists across adaptations)
$\forall c \in \text{Context} : \exists v \in T_{ui} : R_{adapt}(T_{ctx}(c)) = v$ (complete coverage)

component.name: H_{info}
component.description: hierarchical structure of information to disclose

component.name: score_{rel}
component.description: relevance scoring function for each node

formal-spec.content: $\forall t_1, t_2 : t_1 < t_2 \implies \text{Revealed}_{t_1} \subseteq \text{Revealed}_{t_2}$ (never hide revealed info)
$\forall n_1, n_2 : score_{rel}(n_1) > score_{rel}(n_2) \implies t_{reveal}(n_1) \leq t_{reveal}(n_2)$ (high relevance first)
$\forall n, c : c \in \text{children}(n) \implies t_{reveal}(n) < t_{reveal}(c)$ (hierarchical order)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{score}(n,
        ctx) = w_1 \cdot \text{sim}(n.content,
        ctx.query)$$+ w_2 \cdot n.importance$$+ w_3 \cdot \text{novelty}(n,
        \text{Revealed}_t)$where$w_1 + w_2 + w_3 = 1$

$\text{next}(H,
        R) = \arg\max_{n \in H \setminus R} \text{score}(n,
        ctx)$subject to:$\text{parent}(n) \in R$(parent revealed)

component.name: R_{roles}
component.description: role assignment mapping for each agent

formal-spec.content: $\forall a \in \text{ActiveAgents} : a \in A_{roster}$ (all active agents visualized)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{visualize}(C) = G$where$G.vertices = A_{roster}$$G.edges = \{(c.source,
        c.target,
        c.relation) \mid c \in C\}$$\text{layout}(G) = \text{force-directed}$

tuple-notation.content: $T_{activity} = (Events, Timeline, Agents, Actions) : Agent 	imes Time 	o Activity_{log}$

formal-spec.content: $\forall a \in Agents : \exists e \in Events : e.agent = a$ (all agents have events)
$\forall e_1, e_2 : e_1 \xrightarrow{\text{causes}} e_2 \implies e_1.timestamp < e_2.timestamp$

formal-definition.content: $\text{render}(E) = v$where$v.lanes = \{(a, \text{filter}(a)) \mid a \in Agents\}$$v.markers = \{(e.timestamp, e.action) \mid e \in E\}$

formal-spec.content: path = [root, child‚ÇÅ, child‚ÇÇ, ..., current] where child·µ¢ ‚àà children(child·µ¢‚Çã‚ÇÅ)

formal-definition.content:
$compute_path(root: Node, target: Node) ‚Üí Sequence‚ü®Node‚ü© =
    if target = root: [root] else: compute_path(root, parent(target)) ++ [target]$
$navigate(node: Node) ‚Üí Effect = set_location(node) path := compute_path(root, node) render(breadcrumb)$

formal-spec.content: $\forall s \in \Sigma_{state} : \text{handoff}(A_{from}, A_{to}, s) \implies s' = s$ (no state loss)
$\text{handoff}(A_{from}, A_{to}) \implies \exists t : \text{owner}(\text{task}, t^-) = A_{from} \land \text{owner}(\text{task}, t^+) = A_{to}$

formal-definition.content:
$\text{render}(W) = v$where$v.\text{nodes} = \{(n.id,
        n.status,
        n.agent) \mid n \in W.V\}$$v.\text{edges} = W.E$$v.\text{layout} = \text{topological\_sort}(W)$

$\text{execute}(c, W) =$effect
    where$\text{pause} : \forall n \in W.V : n.\text{status} \leftarrow \text{paused}$$\text{cancel} : W \leftarrow \emptyset$$\text{retry} : \text{reset}(\text{failed}(W))$

component.name: A_{assign}
component.description: assignment function mapping role to agent

formal-spec.content: $\forall t \in \text{Tasks} : r^* = \arg\max_{r \in R_{available}} M_{match}(r, t)$ (best match)
$\forall t : t.\text{requirements} \subseteq r^*.\text{capabilities}$ where $r^*$ is selected role
$\forall a : \text{failing}(a) \implies \exists r' : A_{assign}(r', t) = a'$ (can reassign on failure)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{match}(r,
        t) = w_1 \cdot \text{capability\_score}(r,
        t)$$+ w_2 \cdot \text{expertise\_score}(r,
        t)$$+ w_3 \cdot \text{availability}(r)$where$w_1 + w_2 + w_3 = 1$

component.name: A_{atomic}
component.description: set of atomic actions to compose

formal-spec.content: $\forall a_1, a_2 : exec(compose([a_1, a_2])) = exec(a_2) \circ exec(a_1)$ (sequential composition)
$\forall a \in A_{atomic} : \exists u : a.\text{undo} = u$ (every action has undo)

formal-definition.content:
$\text{rollback}(c) =$effect
    where$\forall a \in \text{executed}(c) : a.\text{undo}()$in reverse order of execution

component.name: T_{threshold}
component.description: threshold values for each monitored metric

formal-spec.content: $\forall t : \exists s \in S_{stream} : s.\text{timestamp} = t$ (always monitoring)

formal-definition.content: $\text{detect}(s) = \{a \mid m \in s.\text{metrics} \land |m - \mu_m| > k \cdot \sigma_m\}$where$\mu_m$= mean,$\sigma_m$= std dev,$k$= sensitivity

component.name: U_{user}
component.description: current user state and cognitive load

formal-spec.content: $\forall i \in \text{Interventions} : t_{intervene}(i) < t_{need}(i)$ (intervenes before need arises)

formal-definition.content: $\text{timing}(p, u) = t$where$t = \begin{cases} \text{now} & \text{if } u.\text{load} < \theta_{low} \land p.\text{urgency} = \text{high} \\ \text{next\_break} & \text{if } u.\text{load} \geq \theta_{low} \\ \text{defer} & \text{if } p.\text{confidence} < \theta_{conf} \end{cases}$

formal-spec.content: results sorted by ranker(item, query) descending

formal-definition.content:
$search(q: String) ‚Üí Sequence‚ü®Item‚ü© = candidates := fuzzy_match(index,
        q) scores := map(candidates,
        Œªitem: ranker(item,
        q)) sort(zip(candidates,
        scores),
        by: score,
        desc) ‚Üí take(20)$
$index(items: Set‚ü®Item‚ü©) ‚Üí Effect = for item in items: tokens := tokenize(item) for token in tokens: inverted_index[token] := inverted_index[token] ‚à™ {item}$

$ranker(item: Item,
        query: String) ‚Üí ‚Ñù = w‚ÇÅ¬∑string_similarity(item.name,
        query) + w‚ÇÇ¬∑recency_score(item.timestamp) + w‚ÇÉ¬∑frequency_score(item.access_count)$
